subject: Make ceilometer work with sqla 0.9.x
commit_message:
Make ceilometer work with sqla 0.9.x

Ceilometer's migration 028 makes some very specific assumptions
about sqla data structures and exception paths, which are not
true in sqla 0.9.x. In 0.8 you were shielded from errors on drop
by sqla, but in 0.9 you get raw exceptions from the db layer
thrown all the way up, which causes a failure condition when
trying to delete the non existent alembic table.

We can get basically the same behavior as before by using the
checkfirst=True parameter on table definitions. This will
actually ensure that we get the table in question, and get the
NoSuchTableError when we expect it.

Change-Id: Ida33a3030fb03c2f3eeed9f129fcc0063a7b7c4b

subject: Resource type implementation for software deployment
commit_message:
Resource type implementation for software deployment

Some notes on the implementation:
  * Whenever a config should be deployed, this resource loads the config
    and creates an ephemeral derived config which has the following inputs
    added to it:
    * deploy_server_id
    * deploy_action
    * deploy_stack_id
    * deploy_resource_name
  * When signal_transport=CFN_SIGNAL, the folling input is added:
    * deploy_signal_id
  * When signal_transport=HEAT_SIGNAL, the folling inputs are added:
    * deploy_auth_url
    * deploy_username
    * deploy_password
    * deploy_project_id
    These inputs can be used by the hook *or* by the configuration script
    itself.
  * The ephemeral config also has the current input values inserted into
    the 'value' field of the config inputs. This allows the deployment
    metadata to be a simple list of configs.
  * Subclasses of SoftwareDeployment can make further transformations to
    the ephemeral config, such as transforming the config script to contain
    input values.
  * SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
    output value updates from the server via curl or cfn-signal
  * By default, SoftwareDeployment remains in an IN_PROGRESS state
    until a signal is received
  * If wait_for_signal=False the resource will go immediately to COMPLETE
  * A deployment resource can be configured to deploy on any action.
    By default it deploys on CREATE and UPDATE
  * The outputs deploy_stderr, deploy_stdout and deploy_status_code
    are defined in the attributes schema, but other attributes map to
    whatever outputs are defined for the corresponding config resource
  * The resource will go into a FAILED state if an error_output output
    has a value, or if deploy_status_code is non-zero
  * If the 'name' property is set, this will set the 'name' property
    of the derived config, which will determine the sort order of configs
    returned when fetching a list of config metadata for a given server.
  * When an input_value is set where there is no corresponding config
    inputs schema entry, the derived config will add those input schemas
    to the derived input. This allows some templates to be more DRY.

Implements: blueprint hot-software-config

Change-Id: I97df5651dc6f27ed4ddc7355c21ab61270b15b68

subject: Fix bad exception message output by %(message)s
commit_message:
Fix bad exception message output by %(message)s

Since 'message' is the same name as the second argument to the
constructor, 'message="Oorah"' is not a keyword argument.

Bad example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Oorah

Good example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Volume driver reported
      an error: Oorah

In cinder/utils.py, it is using the invalid keyword arguments as
follows. It is not intended probably.

  raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg)

It is usually 'reason=msg', but since messages would change, put
only 'msg'.

each object's storage policy index in the container's 'object'

In an HA deployment, a 60 seconds delay between reconnects can be quite
problematic. This patch changes the delay calculation by setting the max
delay to 5s and by changing the way it is increased.

Unfortunately, this is one of the places where both our main drivers are
not consistent. Rabbit's driver uses configuration parameters for this
whereas qpid's driver has never had one. However, I would prefer not
adding configuration paremeters to qpid's driver for the following
reasons:

    1. Most of OpenStack services depend on the messaging layer, hence
    they need it to be available. A 5s delay seems to be reasonable and
    I could argue the need of tune it further. Although so frequent
    reconnects can add load to the network, that wouldn't be the main
    issue if one of the brokers go down.
    2. We're trying to move away from configuration options towards using
    transport URL. This path is still not clear and I would
    prefer avoiding adding new options until we clear it out.

subject: Add ability to specify IP for service
commit_message:
Add ability to specify IP for service

The problem that this change addresses is that the address_for method
will not work correctly if there are multiple IP address associated
with the specified interface.

The approach to solving this problem and moving towards the overall
goal of having one place where service networking information is
stored is to convert address_for calls into endpoints, and add a
address() method to the endpoints interface for IP address resolution.

The address() method has the following behavior: if the
bind_interface of an endpoint is set, then the IP is looked up on
the interface.  Otherwise, the IP specified in the host attribute is
returned.  This allows the caller to choose either method of
determining what IP a service will be bound to.

This initial change switches both the openstack-ops-database and
openstack-ops-messaging cookbooks over to use endpoints instead of
address_for.  The other cookbooks will be switched over time.

commit_message:
Update Cinder for long-running snapshot jobs

If a volume snapshot delete operation runs for an extended period
of time, occasionally send Cinder an update indicating that Nova
is still alive and that Cinder should continue to wait for the
operation to complete.

Without this, Cinder will time out and fail a snapshot operation
that runs for an excessively long period of time, even if Nova
is still actively processing it.  This is undesirable because it
leads to an inconsistency between Cinder's view of the snapshot
and what actually exists on the storage backend.

Nova is not required to send an accurate progress -- just an update
for the snapshot id being processed.

This change is backward compatible with Havana Cinder.

subject: enable cloning for rbd-backed ephemeral disks
commit_message:
enable cloning for rbd-backed ephemeral disks

Currently when using rbd as an image backend, nova downloads the
glance image to local disk and then copies it again into rbd. This
can be very slow for large images, and wastes bandwidth as well as
disk space.

When the glance image is stored in the same ceph cluster, the data is
being pulled out and pushed back in unnecessarily. Instead, create a
copy-on-write clone of the image. This is fast, and does not depend
on the size of the image. Instead of taking minutes, booting takes
seconds, and is not limited by the disk copy.

Add some rbd utility functions from cinder to support cloning and
let the rbd imagebackend rely on librbd instead of the rbd
command line tool for checking image existence.

Add an ImageHandler for rbd that does the cloning if an applicable
image location is available. If no such location is available, or rbd
is not configured for ephemeral disks, this handler does nothing, so
enable it by default.

blueprint rbd-clone-image-handler
Closes-bug: 1226351
Change-Id: I9b77a50206d0eda709df8356faaeeba35d232f22
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

subject: Add ability to specify IP for service
commit_message:
Add ability to specify IP for service

The problem that this change addresses is that the address_for method
will not work correctly if there are multiple IP address associated
with the specified interface.

The approach to solving this problem and moving towards the overall
goal of having one place where service networking information is
stored is to convert address_for calls into endpoints, and add a
address() method to the endpoints interface for IP address resolution.

The address() method has the following behavior: if the
bind_interface of an endpoint is set, then the IP is looked up on
the interface.  Otherwise, the IP specified in the host attribute is
returned.  This allows the caller to choose either method of
determining what IP a service will be bound to.

This initial change switches both the openstack-ops-database and
openstack-ops-messaging cookbooks over to use endpoints instead of
address_for.  The other cookbooks will be switched over time.

subject: Ensure detach before teardown in scenario manager
commit_message:
Ensure detach before teardown in scenario manager

A number of the scenario tests have issues with teardown
failing to remove volumes.  Most of these cases are delete
failures due to volume status "in-use".

The root cause of most of these seems to be something going
wrong on the compute side when building an instance, attaching or
detaching causing the test to unexpectedly exit.

The problem is that the teardown in scenario manager is a simple
(albeit clever) thing.delete and it doesn't do any status checking
of the things it's trying to delete.

This patch adds a simple check in the thing.delete loop to see if
the cls object is a cinderclient volumes object, if it is it goes
ahead and issues a detach command on the volume just to make certain
that we've cleaned things up properly even if there was a problem
or failure in the test.

Marking this as 'closes' because the symptom being reported in
multiple bugs is the teardown failure of the volume.  This doesn't
solve the root cause, it only addresses the volume teardown issue.

subject: Nova pagination enhancements
commit_message:
Nova pagination enhancements

Updates the v2 and v3 /servers and /servers/detail APIs to support the
multiple sort keys and sort directions (using the 'sort_key' and
'sort_dir' parameters). These parameters can be specified multiple
times to create a list of sort keys and directions. The 'offset'
parameter is also added. These parameters are passed from the API
layer to the database layer; the datbase layer already supports
them.

A new v3 /servers/count API is added and retrieves the integer
count of servers that match the given sort filters (same filters
as the /servers and /servers/detail APIs). In order to ensure that
the new count function uses the same common code as the existing
APIs, new common functions are added that both paths utilize. New
functions are added to the layers between the API and database to
retrieve the integer count value.

Test cases are added to ensure that the given sort order is honored,
that the offset value is honored, that the next link on the API response
contains the same sorting values and an updated offset (if specified),
and that the count functions return the correct value for various
filters.

commit_message:
Init sphinx config values before accessing them.

Sphinx's config object needs to have its values initialized with
init_values for the values to be loaded from _raw_config into config.
Without this pbr gets null equivalent values from Sphinx's config. These
null values prevented man pages from being built when Sphinx warnerrors
is set. Fix this.

commit_message:
Fixes issues in devstack Ironic setup

Fixes a number of issues in proposed review #70348:

 * Adds package requirements to filse/apts/ironic

   runtime resources

 * On Ubuntu, installs linux headers packages with any DKMS package
